section.content: Chapter 7 For Class XI By : Dinesh Patel PGT [Comp. Sc.] KV Karanja Mumbai Region
Learning Objective : Know about the different datatypes being used in C++ programing language.
void char int float double Functions Pointers References Constants Arrays structure union enumeration class Fundamental Data Types Derived Data Types User Defined Data Types

Means the type of Data and associated operations of handling it. It is of Two Types : (i) Fundamental Data Type : Which is initial, which is already created by the compiler. int, char, float, double, void (ii) Derived Data Type : These are created with the help of Fundamental Data Type. Array, Function, Pointers, references, Constants (iii) User Defined Derived Data Types Classes, Structures, Unions, Enumerations

void : (i) Empty value with no size. char : (i) Only Character viz. A, B, C, D, +, _, & etc. (ii) Size 01 Bytes int : (i) Only natural number viz. 5,9,12,19 etc. (ii) Size 02 bytes. float : (i) Floating point numbers viz. 45.584, 5.3 (ii) Size 04 Bytes double : (i) Floating point numbers viz. 2.54875 (ii) Size 08 Bytes
Signed Unsigned Long Short

Arrays : Collection of similar Data types referred under single name. eg. int AR [10] Roll_no Array 1 Array 2 Array 3 25 42 8 32 14 20 19 Roll No Name Collection 1 Mandeep 50 2 Kamla 20 3 Sonam 100 4 Piyush 80 5 Anubhav 40
Functions : Function can be created anywhere and can be called anywhere. It can perform any task. eg. int add(int x, int y) { int z=0; z = x + y ; return z ; }

Pointers : Pointer is the named memory location that holds the memory address of any other variable. eg. int *ptr ; int x ; x = 21 ; ptr = & x ; Address of variable x int ptr 1011 101010 21 int x 1011
References : It is the alternative name of any Object. eg. int total ; total = 50 ; int &sum = total ; Here ‘total’ also referred ‘sum’.
Structures and Classes Group of object sharing common characteristics and behavior . struct dog { head mouth leg barking }; class dog { head mouth leg barking }; User Defined Data Type
Union : This is the memory location that is being shared by Two or more different variables of different data types. eg. union shared_eg { int x; char ch ; } cnvt ; cnvt Byte Byte ch x

Enumeration : An alternative method for naming Integer constant. By default it start from 0 ; eg. const int cat = 0; const int bat = 1; const int rat = 2; or enum day { cat, bat, rat} ; Both above are same.
Presented by : Dinesh Patel PGT Comp. Sc. KV, NAD Karanja
